poem:
Title: "In The Web of Meta"

Iron-barred giants in vainglorious dome,
Stooping to glean ripples from news's home.
Ah, Meta, your art is as a cipher,
A ceaseless road to the content lifter.
Courting the coin for a phantom's dance,
In algorithms, Australian words lance.
AI's lessons are by subtleties spread,
Not in the new, but the old-fashioned thread.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Australian news media could seek payment from Meta for content used to train AI Australian media companies could seek compensation from Meta for its use of online news sources in training generative AI technology, researchers have said. When Meta announced last week that it would not sign new deals to pay for news in Australia for use on Facebook, it downplayed the value of news to its services, stating that just 3% of Facebook usage". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
